sentence.Network_en: The elder brother is a clotheshorse while the younger one is slovenly.
sentence.Network_cn: 老大衣冠楚楚,老二则不修边幅.

sentence.Network_en: Mary is such a clotheshorse! Look at her now.
sentence.Network_cn: 玛丽真是个摩登女郎! 瞧她那身打扮!

sentence.Network_en: Look, the clotheshorse becomes the scenery.
sentence.Network_cn: 瞧!我们租住的小窝, 晒衣架也成了风景.

list.abs: ·A clotheshorse讲究穿戴的人Princess Diana was a real clotheshorse. It’s hard.

means.word_mean: 1. a framework on which to hang clothes (as for drying)
2. a man who is much concerned with his dress and appearance
